meta.title: District Home - Chappaqua Central School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: District Home - Chappaqua Central School District

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: District Home, Chappaqua Central School District
District Home - Chappaqua Central School District
District Home - Chappaqua Central School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme4

div.div: Approximately 4,000 students attend three elementary schools (K-4), two middle schools (5-8), and one high school (9-12).

The Chappaqua Central School District is a nationally renowned, suburban public school system characterized by highly motivated students, a broadly educated and talented staff, and an actively involved parent community.
The Board of Education is composed of five members elected by the community, each serving a staggered three-year term.
Chappaqua is a lively and dynamic community of 17,000 residents who enjoy the small-town atmosphere and close proximity to New York City.

img.alt: Exterior of the Ed Center, a brick building with trees and a staricase out in front
Students and staff in organge shirts forming the letter "G".
Lion statue outside of Roaring Brook School.
Wooden sign and landscaped area as you enter the Westorchard parting lot.
Stone exterior of Bell Middle School.
Wavey wall and hallway inside SB middle school.
students walking to class outside and inside the elevated, covered walkway.
